How the Grinch Stole Christmas!.

	She's the one the Grinch meets when he's stealing her family's Christmas tree.

questions.explanation:
The Lorax.

	The Oncler is the villain who ruins the environment.

Horton Hatches the Egg.

	Lazy Mayzie Bird leaves Horton the elephant to hatch her egg.

options: Yertle the Turtle and Other Stories
questions.explanation:
Bartholomew and the Oobleck.

	King Derwin gets bored with ordinary weather and orders his magicians to create something new. They create dangerous gluey green oobleck.

options: One Fish, Two Fish, Red Fish, Blue Fish
The Cat in the Hat Comes Back
questions.explanation:
The Cat in the Hat.

	They're those crazy blue-haired kite fliers in red jumpsuits that the Cat keeps in a box. (In the sequel, the Cat brings Little Cats A-Z with him.)

options: I Had Trouble in Getting to Solla Sollew
questions.explanation:
Oh, the Places You'll Go!.

	"But on you will go/though the weather be foul. On you will go/though your enemies prowl. On you will go/though the Hakken-Kraks howl." The Hakken-Kraks are giant, howling sea monsters.

The 500 Hats of Bartholomew Cubbins.

	Grand Duke Wilfred is King Derwin's spoiled-rotten nephew. Wilfred proposes to push poor Bartholomew Cubbins from the castle's highest turret as a means of getting the boy to take off his hat. But the Grand Duke gets his comeuppance in the end: a spanking from his royal uncle.

Horton Hears a Who!.

	The Wickershams are mean monkeys who try to boil Horton's flower and dust speck (peopled with tiny beings called Whos) in Beezle-Nut oil.

options: And to Think That I Saw It on Mulberry Street
questions.explanation:
Scrambled Eggs Super!.

	Peter travels to the ends of the earth to gather hundreds of eggs--in assorted sizes, colors, and patterns--for his "Scrambled eggs Super-dee-Dooper-dee-Booper Special de luxe a-la Peter T. Hooper!"
